Author: tholin
Content: Is there a way for me to run the KLayout DRC checks on a GDSII file without running the full chip_top flow? I just want to know if my DACs still have DRC errors without waiting 4+ hours for DRC to run on the full chip.

Author: 246tnt
Content: `klayout -b -zz -r ${PDK_ROOT}/gf180mcuD/libs.tech/klayout/tech/drc/gf180mcu.drc -rd input=your.gds -rd report=drc.klayout.lyrdb -rd feol=True -rd beol=True -rd dummy=True -rd offgrid=True -rd conn_drc=True -rd wedge=True -rd run_mode=deep -rd thr=16`

Author: 246tnt
Content: That's the command run by the pre-check.

Author: tholin
Content: Its so annoying to me that I can spend days putting something together in magic until its DRC clean, and then KLayout comes in "Actshually, there is 107 DRC errors"

Author: 246tnt
Content: I think that's pretty much the deal of being on this first run is that you're beta testing stuff ...

Author: 246tnt
Content: Although I'm looking at some of the error in KLayout and ... they might be false positive.

Author: tholin
Content: I have tons of DRC errors for this. So uhm. Is it too long? Too short? What is the limit?

Author: tholin
Content: Am I about to have to dive into some source code just to know what this is about?
